alert.note: Alert for Lander Foothills; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 23 at 5:09AM MDT until April 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow in the Lander Foothills with total snowfall of 3 to 5 inches. Most of the Wind River Basin will see an inch or less of snowfall, but high elevations of the basin may see 2 or 3 inches. North wind frequently gusting 25 to 35 mph. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains East, Wind River Basin and Lander Foothills. * WHEN...Until 6 PM. The heaviest snowfall is expected to occur through early afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery to slushy road conditions in places until late morning. Roads are expected to become mainly wet for the afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Backcountry enthusiasts, including snowmobilers, can easily become disoriented and lost. Frostbite and hypothermia can set in quickly.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Lander Foothills; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East
